column4: Hey all, I'm gonna upgrade my gfx card 8600GT -> 9800GT do I need to remove my nvidia-drivers first, and then reinstall then again, once I've changed the card?
what drivers are you using now?
how do I find that out lol? /proc/?
well System > Administration > Hardware Drivers
oh, it says NVIDIA accelerated graphic driver (latest cards)
Does it have a version number ex: 177
no ..
are you running intrepid?
you should be fine. Assuming its using atleast 177
no its not
its using 169.
you need to either use envyng or install the drivers from nvidia.
let me doulbe check that though
oh, ok, so I'll have to remove the drivers and then reinstall them once I've changed the card?
ok...
it would work if you just put the card in and booted; however, you should install the newer driver from nvidia.com either from their site or with envyng

There are some performance issues with the nvidia-glx-new package and your card in hardy. Because its newer hardware they added more support in newer drivers that are on nvidia's site and in the intrepid repos.
Thanks. So I should use the envyng instead of nvidias official drivers?
they both accomplish the same thing.
ok, thanks. I'll change the card now.

from what I understand envyng takes care of some things for you making it easier. But I think either way is easier.  You should be able to change the card and install the drivers later if you have issues.
